isis.stitle: SPICER 14 INCH (350 MM) SOLO CLUTCH - INSTALL - TRANSMISSION

note.para: Check wear on clutch release yoke fingers, cross shaft and cross shaft bushings. Replace if necessary.
Lubricate the release bearing housing and wear pads, and cross shaft bushings prior to installing the transmission. Refer to LUBRICATION.

step1.para: Shift the transmission into gear so the main drive gear can be rotated during assembly to line up driven disc hub splines with the transmission input shaft splines.
Install the clutch brake if used ( Figure 29).
Use a suitable sling or transmission jack to support and align the transmission with the engine.

caution.para: Do not let the transmission drop or hang unsupported in the driven discs.

step1.para: Rotate the clutch release yoke rearward and center the yoke on the drive gear bearing cap. The yoke must be held in this position. Start the input shaft into the clutch release bearing sleeve. Slide the transmission forward to pick up the driven disc splines. It might be necessary to rotate the transmission output shaft to align the input shaft and driven disc splines ( Figure 30).

figure.caption: Figure 30. Center Clutch Release Yoke on Drive Gear Bearing Cap

step1.para: Observe through the hand hole opening in the bell housing to make certain the release bearing assembly is vertical with the flat section on top and the clutch release yoke fingers are tipped up and centered to pass over the release pads of the release bearing assembly ( Figure 31).

figure.caption: Figure 31. Make Sure Release Bearing Assembly is Vertical With Flat Section on Top and Clutch Release Yoke Fingers are Tipped Up

step1.para: When the clutch release yoke fingers pass over the release bearing assembly thrust pads, turn the release shaft to swing the release yoke fingers down in front of the release bearing thrust pads ( Figure 32).

figure.caption: Figure 32. Turn Release Shaft to Swing Release Yoke Fingers Down

note.para: Interference of the release yoke fingers with the clutch cover assembly will prevent assembly of the transmission or cause binding of the release shaft if it is not rotated.

step1.para: Engage the clutch housing pilot into the flywheel housing and align the bolt holes. Start all bolts and tighten progressively around the housing.
Depress the clutch pedal 5 times to adjust the clutch.

Check for correct free travel, release bearing travel and clutch brake squeeze. Free travel should be 1/16 to 1/8 inch and release travel is 1/2 inch minimum. Refer to Group 11-LINKAGE in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for the model being serviced.
